bioghist.p: Villanova University traces its origins to old Saint Augustine's Church in Philadelphia, which the Augustinians founded in 1796, and to its parish school, Saint Augustine's Academy, established in 1811. Villanova University has been sponsored by the Augustinian Order since its founding in 1842. Today, the University is comprised of five colleges: Liberal Arts and Sciences (Villanova College), Engineering, School of Business (formerly known as the College of Commerce and Finance), Nursing and the School of Law.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of materials related to academic, social, cultural, and religious events at Villanova University. The materials document events such as music and dance performances; lectures, workshops, and symposia; dinners; student dances and proms; groundbreakings and laying of cornerstones; building and room dedications; exhibitions; and retreats and masses. Types of materials include invitations, announcements, brochures, tickets and passes, dance cards, flyers and posters, newspaper clippings, articles in newsletters and magazines, typed and manuscript addresses, and lists of award recipients. Printed materials make up the bulk of the collection, but there are also minutes, reports, correspondence, and some financial and planning records. Of note are records of the 100th and 125th anniversaries of Villanova University; records of the Mendel Medal, honorary degrees and other awards; commencement invitations dating back to 1853; commencement addresses by invited speakers and students; and records of the inaugurations of President Edmund J. Dobbin (1988) and President Peter M. Donohue (2006).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
